summary: This is an email chain forwarding a letter from Ghislaine Maxwell's defense counsel to prosecutors regarding discovery and prison conditions. It shows communication between Maxwell's legal team and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York about her case.

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: Attorney from Cohen & Gresser LLP who sent the letter regarding Ghislaine Maxwell to prosecutors.

persons.context: Subject of the legal letter regarding discovery and prison conditions.

persons.name: Mark S. Cohen
persons.context: Copied on the email from Christian Everdell, likely part of Maxwell's defense team.

events.title: Defense Letter Regarding Discovery and Prison Conditions
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense counsel sends a letter to prosecutors regarding discovery issues and Maxwell's prison conditions.

locations: 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team, led by Christian Everdell of Cohen & Gresser LLP, is communicating with federal prosecutors about her case.
The communication involves a letter regarding discovery and Maxwell's prison conditions, indicating ongoing legal proceedings and concerns about her detention.
The email shows coordination among multiple defense attorneys (Everdell, Cohen, Menninger, Pagliuca) and prosecutors (Maurene, Alison, Lara) in the Southern District of New York.
The document demonstrates formal legal correspondence between defense and prosecution teams during Maxwell's pre-trial phase in September 2020.
